Class MapWidgetText

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.map.widgets.MapWidget
      • com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.map.widgets.MapWidgetText
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Tickable, MapDisplayEvents

    public class MapWidgetText
extends MapWidget
    Displays text in a custom font and color

      • getShadowColor

        public byte getShadowColor()
        Gets the shadow color of the text. When set non-transparent, a duplicate of the text is drawn at an offset underneath the text with this color
        Returns:
        shadow color

      • setShadowColor

        public MapWidgetText setShadowColor(byte color)
        Sets the shadow color of the text. When set non-transparent, a duplicate of the text is drawn at an offset underneath the text with this color
        Parameters:
        color - to set to
        Returns:
        this text widget

      • onDraw

        public void onDraw()
        Description copied from class: MapWidget
        Called when the widget should be re-drawn onto the map display. When this is called, the old area the widget was displayed has already been cleared.
